Bind rows by a query. Assumes all tables structured identically.

Bind rows by a query. Assumes all tables structured identically.

bind_rows_q(tableNames, colNames, my_db, resultTableName, ...,
  origTableColumn = NULL)

Arguments

tableNames

names of tables to concatinate (not empty)
colNames

names of columns
my_db

connection to where tables live
resultTableName

name of result table
...

force later arguments to bind by name
origTableColumn

character, column to put original table name in.

Value

resultTableName

Examples


my_db <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")
DBI::dbWriteTable(my_db,
                  'd1',
                   data.frame(x=1:2, y= 10:11),
                   overwrite = TRUE,
                   temporary = TRUE)
DBI::dbWriteTable(my_db,
                  'd2',
                   data.frame(x=3:4, y= 13:14),
                   overwrite = TRUE,
                   temporary = TRUE)
bind_rows_q(tableNames = c('d1', 'd2'),
           colNames = c('x', 'y'),
           my_db = my_db,
           resultTableName = 'res1',
           origTableColumn = 'orig_table')
#> [1] "res1"
cdata::qlook(my_db, 'res1')
#> table `res1` SQLiteConnection 
#>  nrow: 4 
#> 'data.frame':	4 obs. of  3 variables:
#>  $ x         : int  1 2 3 4
#>  $ y         : int  10 11 13 14
#>  $ orig_table: chr  "d1" "d1" "d2" "d2"
DBI::dbDisconnect(my_db)
